reviews.review_msg: I don't even know how she's qualified for her job. She often lets TAs handle the class, shows up late (sometimes doesn't show up at all), but still forces students to attend while putting in absolutely zero effort herself. Her only focus and passion seem to be making students' lives as miserable as possible.
Absolutely horrible and worst TA ever. Doesn't know what she is doing and just takes marks away from you.
Tara's class is a mixed bag - disorganized at times, but the content is straightforward. unstuck study was a lifesaver for preparing for the easy final.

Absolutely terrible professor, most disrespect tone and is never open to constructive criticism. 

Does not care about students grades, will deduct marks off the most bizarre errors, and in office hours will belittle your opinion.

Worst part is it takes her 5 minutes to state something as she talks in 0.25 speed.

AVOID AT ALL COST

She clearly doesn't care about her students or the quality of teaching. She lets TAs teach the classes and has come to lectures late countless times (sometimes an hour late). She was even late for the final exam. Extremely irresponsible and unprofessional. The course material is like that for elementary school students.
This course taught by Tara was beyond useless. If you already know how to write you'll do well. If you don't know how to write you'll struggle or fail.

Although I got an A+ in this course, Tara is one of the worst profs I've encountered at SFU. She is unorganized, rude, and unhelpful. I'm 90% sure that most people who sent her emails throughout the semester received replies roughly a month after the email was sent whilst some received nothing. Avoid this class (and this prof) unless required.
Avoid this terrible prof if you can.

This was the worst class I have taken in my life. If this course was not a requirement of my degree, would have never taken this. The marking criteria was not clear for the assignments and she is a really tough grader. I wasn't sure till the day of final exam what the syllabus was.

Tara Immell is not a good professor to take classes with.
Some Cons:
-Messy and Unorganized
-Often late to class, 40 min late first day
-Unclear assignment criteria
-insanely slow marking
-mandatory in class discussion that she tried so hard to enforce(ie. seat number)
Pros:
-easiest final of my life
-can do other class work in Tara's class
She yells into the mic and doesn't teach anything
Cartoon Network type class.
This class is a joke

She somehow made an easy class hard. The rubric of the essays was never an accurate depiction of how well your essay would be. She was extremely condescending to talk to and talked with a fake nice tone in lectures. In the final the instructions were unclear and all she said to clear it up was to do what you think is best. Take someone else.

I genuinely wish she would use her time to actually prepare to give informative lectures instead of spending so much energy and time preventing students from posting discussions from outside the course. If she actually gave useful lectures (or at least tried..), students would love to attend lectures even without the participation marks.

Lectures are required since there are in-class participation marks, but none of the material is relevant to the papers she assigns. The final was split into sections and horribly organized, as TA's were handing out papers during the exam times. All the feedback marks are copy and paste, and very unclear as to why marks were docked.

Tara is an amazing teacher especially when it comes to teaching the important ideas of writing a good research paper. It's required to come to every lecture because she gives discussions every class and it counts as participation marks. If you have any concerns its good to ask her because she is very helpful and caring. Overall, its awesome course.

Tara was disorganized and made the class much harder than it had to be. Here's my advice:
- go to the lectures, the participation marks are really helpful in the end
- the final is very easy, but take your time
- make friends in the class
- Tara is a very sweet person and easy to talk to.
If you put in the effort, it's an easy class.

The course was honestly straightforward. Her lectures weren't beneficial. I just went to every lecture because of the class attendance. It is a straightforward course overall; use myBib for the references and Grammarly for proofreading and ask the chatgpt for guidance. You should easily get a B+ if your English isn't too weak.

Lectures were stretched out and disengaging. The material taught was common knowledge and basic english. The only thing I learned in this class was how to write in IEEE format, which we learn ourselves. Get ready for vague feedback that takes months to get and limited, delayed communication with the TAs and Tara through coursys only (no emails).

The only redeeming factor for this class is that the course seems to be curved. Lectures have participation marks and were so heavily disorganized that she forgot to give breaks and needed constant tech support. TAs couldn't mark properly, were generally rude, and took months to grade assignments. We all cheered/clapped for her in the last class.

The most boring lectures I have had to sit through. Unfortunately, attendance was mandatory because of small assignments done during lectures. When I asked questions about the material she was supposed to be teaching, she often told me to Google it. Grading took incredibly long, and I am still without a grade on some of my assignments.

I would strongly advise to not take this professor, I am currently on the day of the final and only know 25% of my marks at this moment. She is unhelpful when asked, nothing is marked, and none of the assignments are properly explained and given a rubric.

Unfortunately, due to the TSSA strikes, the course is very poorly managed as a whole. Tara is not able to keep the course functioning while TSSA goes on. Many different online systems are required to be used, and none of them function well. Marking is extremally slow, and assignment guidelines aren't clear until less than 24 hours before deadline.

The biggest waste of time in my life. Her lectures are completely incoherent (talks about things that are completely unrelated to class and wastes hours). Her voice is unbearable and condescending. Things that have been handed in for months sit unmarked. Be prepared to do every assignment in the blind and with 0 support from her.

Tara is extremely disorganized, gives unclear feedback and confusing criteria, changes the assignment requirements right before the due dates, and overall makes this class much more frustrating than it has to be. Assignments are fairly easy but very harshly graded. You will lose tons of marks for the smallest details if you aren't careful.

Where do I even start? She teaches elementary-level grammar to university students, takes attendance, and doesn't give criteria for assignments. It's the end of the semester, and we've gotten two assignments back. She goes over the least applicable information to the course and leaves all the students wondering what she wants. Terrible professor.

IEEE format is on the final but we were never taught it in class? 

This is supposed to be an English class, taking 3 hours per week... and didn't find time to teach us ONE OF THE TWO CITATION FORMATS WE NEED FOR THE FINAL?

Okay, professor, doesn't teach much during class and assignments are a bit vague but in terms of difficulty not bad. An example of this is requiring IEEE in 1 of her essays despite not teaching it. Expect to do most work in your own time in this class, not much assistance.

Tara is such a terrible professor it's crazy. No rubrics for anything and no feedbacks for anything either. Does not communicate with anyone not even the TAs and is impossible to reach out to outside of class. She has the most annoying voice ever and never stops talking. She will make this class and your life so much harder than it has to be.

Changes criteria the day before the assignment is due.

Late to class on the first day.

Does not show up to own office hours.

Blames the TAs for everything.

Marks are not on the rubric that was given.

Does not respond to the discussion board or responds three weeks late after an assignment was due.

Nothing is done smoothly.

I never knew a class could get as boring as this one gets. 

The assignments are relentless, with grading so harsh that even children would choose to work in a factory in China than take this course. On top of that, the feedback was non-existent and wrong.

Only take this course if it is required. It is not worth it.

Somehow made a 100 level course so tedious, time consuming, and uninteresting. Extremely late grading, up to 2 months after the assignment is due, worst rubrics I've personally seen, 0 communication with her TAs, and unreachable out of class. Assignments build up from previous ones, so no feedback and/or grading makes students feel very lost.
CMPT105W makes me sad. I don't know what to do in life because of Tara Immell.

This class is mandatory for computing science students, and if the only option available is Tara, it is manageable. But this class has been a mess since the start. Assignments are posted in random places, criteria and feedback is very vague, and marking is unfair. Also, the professor is incredibly disorganized, assignments are changed the day befor

it's a first year science writing for class. The teacher and the teaching method is clumsy. No organization, the teacher want to do so many different things and she cannot handle those things herself. I rarely review prof but this one. Avoid at all cost.

In 2 and a half months so far I have learned a grand total of 0 things. People are playing video games on their laptops instead of paying attention and 90% of the class only attends for participation marks. Please never take this class with Tara Immell. She changes assignments last min, is condescending, requires attendance and haunts my dreams.

Although 105w is a boring course, Tara makes it so much worse. Lectures are on elementary school grammar where participation is necessary. She does not respond to student's questions at all, she changed the criteria on the last day for a video of ourselves presenting, making everyone who finished restart, terrible professor, avoid if possible.
Terrible. Doesn't explain anything, it's awful AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Tara Immell does not teach at all, she extends what should be a 20 minute lecture in a 2 hour lecture. She places all the work onto the TA's, if you email to ask her a question she will redirect you to coursys, where she won't respond. We had a presentation draft due on a Friday and she didn't answer questions about it until Thursday(the day before

Lectures are useless but mandatory because of random participation marks. Gave us instructions for a PowerPoint one day before it was due. Haven't learned much. Doesn't respond to emails or discussion boards.

Utterly useless. Does not respond to the discussion page she FORCED us to start using at the beginning of the semester. Her curriculum consists of talking about APA7 in every lecture, and has very unclear instructions in general. Not very lenient either.

Sorry for my poor English, but I took a writing course with Tara Immell. She makes attendance mandatory with in-class discussion questions worth marks. It's a writing course, but she doesn't care for that and only wants to go on random tangents about insignificant topics. None of the lectures are worth going to. I never enjoyed any of the lectures.

- One of the worst so far, frustrating. 
- The grading criteria do not make sense, there is no clear path to success in this course. 
- She was not there for half of the classes and I learned nothing. 
- Waste of money, time, energy. 

Just avoid her, this is an easy course, take it with anyone other than her.
She thinks this writing stuff is important to us but it is not. Tara somehow managed to make an EASY course hard. Condescending is not cut out be an organized, responsible professional.
Honestly, I literally could not name you even a single thing that I learned this semester. A complete waste of money, absolutely ridiculous that this is a required course for CS. Terrible professor.

She cut our final exam time in half. Lied about the exam content. Said she would tell us if we could use our laptops during the exam, and never followed up on it, then got mad at those who didn't bring one. Disrespectful to students as well.
subpar

She didn't show up to class for more than a month. She didn't tell anyone where she was or reply to emails. I was worried she had an emergency and hoped she was okay. Guess where she was when she came back? ON VACATION IN CHICAGO. She said her flight back was cancelled but that doesn't excuse a whole month off in the middle of the term. Why?

There was hardly anything taught in the class. Disengaging lectures and most of what is told in lectures is just common sense. The assignments are too time consuming and tiresome. I also find it weird that you get marks for just showing up to the class when you hardly learn anything. The lectures might cure your insomnia though.

I'm a third year computer science student at took this course seems like the professor forgot this is a 100 level writing course not 400. She doesn't even show up to class 80% of the times and still manage to get paid! The course material is so unorganized, and she doesn't know what she's doing. I feel so bad for the money I spent to be in her clas

Always changes the criteria the day before an assignment is due. Doesn't show up to class, doesn't communicate, and only tells her TA what to say at the last minute to throw them under the bus when students are rightfully upset. Expects students to rewrite their entire paper when the criteria is changed the day before it is due.

Joke of a prof. Can't show marking scheme until two days before an essay a do and screws me by rewriting my essay. Also the frequency of her showing up to my class is how my father go gets milk. Can't take a skill issue that this class sucks and forces 10% participation mark and counts who is present to class.

Lectures are loaded with personal stories that do not help with assignments. Does not respond to emails or messages. Does not provide a grading rubric for any assignment until AFTER a draft is due. We are finishing working on the final paper and JUST NOW learned how to look for reliable sources, but still no mention of how to write an intro/thesis.
Prof will give a week long assignment, only post the grading criteria the day its due, and remove marks for not following the guidelines. This course will drop your GPA if taken with her. AVOID

Will change assignment criteria last minute.
Would rather go on tangents about unrelated topics rather than go over the assignments. Will not answer questions or emails.

In class participation assignments, but with only 2 min to submit. She gave us 30 min on the first day but shortened it due to "not everyone submitting on time"????

Avoid.

Extremely disorganized. No clear instructions.
TAs do not know how to make a proper presentation and they are supposed to teach you how to make one! lol.
very unreliable in giving advice.
I would not recommend anyone to take any course with this instructor.
you are gonna have anxiety, and a lot of hard times.
